alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:46PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR YOUNG TO CLINTS WELL TO SOUTH OF WINSLOW THROUGH 430 PM MST... At 345 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 22 miles south of Winslow to 8 miles north of Christopher Creek to Young. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Star Valley, Haigler Creek, Tonto Village, Whispering Pines, Young, Clints Well, Christopher Creek, Starlight Pines, Kohls Ranch, Hunter Creek, Washington Park, Mead Ranch, Forest Road 169 Campground, Bear Flat, Upper Tonto Creek Campground, Clints Well Campground, Ponderosa Campground, Forest Road 195 Campground, Chevelon Butte, and Rim Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 288 between mile markers 302 and 311. State Route 260 between mile markers 256 and 281. State Route 87 between mile markers 291 and 331. State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County
